profile.name: Addy Osmani
profile.bio: Engineering Lead @Google on Chrome & Web Platform. Passionate about #GoLang, performance, & DX. Sharing insights, learning in public. All opinions my own. ✨🚀

tweets.content: Me: 'It works on my machine!' My teammate: 'That's exactly the problem.' #DevHumor #Debugging
Fantastic progress on @OpenWebDocs browser compatibility data for new CSS features. This collaborative effort is key to a healthier web ecosystem. Keep it up! #WebStandards #Interoperability
Just spent an hour hunting down a memory leak caused by an unclosed WebWorker. The smallest things can have the biggest impact! Always profile. #Debugging #WebDev
Accessibility isn't a feature you tack on at the end; it's a fundamental principle woven into every stage of development. Build inclusively from day one. #A11y #WebDesign
Discovered a neat trick with `scroll-snap-type` today for building highly performant carousels without much JS. Details in a small Codepen soon! #CSS #WebDevTips
Exploring the `PerformanceObserver` API more deeply. Super powerful for catching long tasks and layout shifts in production. Need to write up a quick guide. #WebPerformance #JavaScript
Just saw the latest #ChromeDevTools update announcement! The new CSS overview panel looks incredibly useful for identifying perf bottlenecks. Big congrats to the team! 🎉 #WebPlatform
Just submitted a PR to the WICG Fenced Frames spec clarifying some edge cases around event propagation. Every little bit helps make the web more robust! #OpenSource #WebStandards
Unpopular opinion: The complexity introduced by certain 'modern' build tools often outweighs the benefits for anything but the largest applications. Simpler setups deserve more love. #WebDev
Had a great brainstorming session with the Chrome team today on optimizing JS engine startup. So many exciting challenges ahead! #Google #Chrome #V8
If your SPA bundle size is over 1MB *before* tree-shaking, you might need to rethink some dependencies. Performance starts at the first byte. #WebPerformance #JavaScript
Progressive Enhancement is not dead, it's just sometimes harder to implement with highly interactive SPAs. But the core principles remain critical for resilience. #WebDev #Performance
Blown away by the latest @nextjs release! The improvements to HMR and build times are truly game-changing. The ecosystem keeps innovating. #React #WebDev
Found this gem of an article on optimizing font loading with `font-display` and critical CSS. Sharing because it's super actionable. #WebPerformance #CSS

Been pondering the future of client-side architecture. Are we heading towards more fine-grained islands of interactivity, or a resurgence of full-stack monolithic frameworks? Probably both. #WebArchitecture
Spent the afternoon diving deep into WebGPU shaders. The performance gains are wild, but the learning curve is real. Building a small particle simulation demo. #WebGPU #GraphicsDev
My relationship status with CSS grid areas is 'It's complicated, but I still love you.' Every time I think I've mastered it, a new challenge appears. #CSS #WebDevHumor
Excited to share I'll be speaking at @ChromeDevSummit (virtually!) this year on some upcoming #WebPlatform capabilities. Stay tuned for details! #Google #WebDev
Huge shoutout to everyone contributing to the Lighthouse project! Your efforts make the web faster and more accessible for everyone. Thank you! 🙏 #OpenSource #Lighthouse
My brain after spending 3 hours debugging a phantom CSS issue only to realize it was a missing semicolon: 🤯 #DevLife #WebDev
